citation.article-title: Proposal of the genera Anaerococcus gen. nov., Peptoniphilus gen. nov. and Gallicola gen. nov. for members of the genus Peptostreptococcus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Anaerococcus prevotii comb. nov.
Basonym: Peptostreptococcus prevotii (Foubert and Douglas 1948) Ezaki et al. 1983.
Often isolated from human clinical specimens such as vaginal discharges and ovarian, peritoneal and sacral abscesses.
Negative for indole, alkaline phosphatase and coagulase.
Most strains ferment glucose and mannose.
Acid is also produced from raffinose, ribose and mannose.
No acid produced from lactose, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose or xylose.
Major metabolic end-product from PYG is butyric acid.
Descriptions of major saccharolytic and proteolytic enzymes are given by Murdoch (1998).
Differential characteristics from other members of the genus are given in Table 3.
The G+C content of the DNA is 29-33 mol%.
